item.description:
The friends of Belle Isle marsh are sponsoring a talk by Archeologist Vic Mastone at the Orient Heights Yatch club in East Boston this coming Monday April 2cnd. Vic is the Director of the Massachusetts Board of Underwater Archaeological Resources. He has been in the local news lately for his underwater exploration to uncover the history of the battle of Chelsea Creek- the first Naval battle in US history and the second battle of the revolutionary war.

The friends of Belle Isle Marsh sponsor a variety of ocean related talks on things like the Mass harbor pilots association, the Massachusetts Lobstermen's association, and the state of local beaches. The Orient Heights Yacht club is a beautiful waterfront facility just a 5 minute walk from Orient Heights station with easy street parking as well.

Here are some details on the friends website:

http://www.friendsofbelleislemarsh.org/

For the especially motivated - the Massachusetts Board of Underwater Archaeological Resources

http://www.mass.gov/czm/buar/
item.name: Underwater Archeology talk on The Battle of Chelsea Creek
